repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
In order to be called efficiently, these functions must have the exception specification set in the pxd file since Cython is unable to assume an implicit exception specification.

This improves the quality of the messages to draw attention to this detail.

Closes #6001

comment_data.body: Can't these go to the end, so that we don't need to update all performance hint warning lines?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -41,6 +41,12 @@ cpdef void release_gil_in_nogil2() nogil:
     with nogil:
         pass
 
+cdef int f_in_pxd1() nogil except -1:
+    return 0
+
+cdef int f_in_pxd2() nogil:  # implicit except -1?
+    return 0
+

comment_data.body: I assume this can't be done in a srctree test since we don't check for warnings/perfhints there. That's a bit unfortunate but well, probably not worth changing soon.
Yes that's why I've done it like this.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -5515,6 +5517,9 @@ def write_noexcept_performance_hint(pos, env, function_name=None, void_return=Fa
         solutions.append(
             "Use an 'int' return type on %s to allow an error code to be returned." %
             the_function)
+    if is_from_pxd and not void_return:
+        solutions.append(
+            "Declare any exception value explicitly for functions in pxd files.")

comment_data.body: That's mostly because it's not on the first line of the message and the tests don't currently capture the rest. I'm not sure that's hugely easy to change (although it would probably be possible).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -5515,6 +5517,9 @@ def write_noexcept_performance_hint(pos, env, function_name=None, void_return=Fa
         solutions.append(
             "Use an 'int' return type on %s to allow an error code to be returned." %
             the_function)
+    if is_from_pxd and not void_return:
+        solutions.append(
+            "Declare any exception value explicitly for functions in pxd files.")

comment_data.body: Ah. Ok. Well. Not for now then.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -5515,6 +5517,9 @@ def write_noexcept_performance_hint(pos, env, function_name=None, void_return=Fa
         solutions.append(
             "Use an 'int' return type on %s to allow an error code to be returned." %
             the_function)
+    if is_from_pxd and not void_return:
+        solutions.append(
+            "Declare any exception value explicitly for functions in pxd files.")

@@ -896,6 +896,17 @@ def declare_cfunction(self, name, type, pos,
                 elif not in_pxd and entry.defined_in_pxd and type.compatible_signature_with(entry.type):
                     # TODO: check that this was done by a signature optimisation and not a user error.
                     #warning(pos, "Function signature does not match previous declaration", 1)
+
+                    # Cython can't assume anything about cimported functions declared without
+                    # an exception value. This is a performance problem mainly for nogil functions.
+                    if entry.type.nogil and entry.type.exception_value is None and type.exception_value:
+                        performance_hint(
+                            entry.pos,
+                            f"No exception value declared for '{entry.name}' in pxd file.\n"
+                            "Users cimporting this function and calling it without the gil "
+                            f"will always require an exception check.\n"

comment_data.body: Doesn't hurt since Python will be happy to ignore it after parsing, but well, yes, it's redundant. I'll remove it in master.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -896,6 +896,17 @@ def declare_cfunction(self, name, type, pos,
                 elif not in_pxd and entry.defined_in_pxd and type.compatible_signature_with(entry.type):
                     # TODO: check that this was done by a signature optimisation and not a user error.
                     #warning(pos, "Function signature does not match previous declaration", 1)
+
+                    # Cython can't assume anything about cimported functions declared without
+                    # an exception value. This is a performance problem mainly for nogil functions.
+                    if entry.type.nogil and entry.type.exception_value is None and type.exception_value:
+                        performance_hint(
+                            entry.pos,
+                            f"No exception value declared for '{entry.name}' in pxd file.\n"
+                            "Users cimporting this function and calling it without the gil "
+                            f"will always require an exception check.\n"

commit.message:
Improve performance hints for nogil + pxd

In order to be called efficiently, these functions must
have the exception specification set in the pxd file since
Cython is unable to assume an implicit exception specification.

This improves the quality of the messages to draw attention to
this detail.

Closes #6001
Move new functions to the end

title: Improve performance hints for nogil + pxd
